channel.title: New ideas for private servers
channel.description:
Does anyone have any creative ideas or features in mind that you would like to see in private servers? If you have any, please post them for anyone who would like to try to code it out.
Get it?

item.title: New ideas for private servers
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Jamie1200, post:6, topic:331655”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=428033.msg3144142#msg3144142 date=1267906651]
Make a multi-player deathmatch mini game. Points go in increments relative to the amount of kills you obtain. You respawn as it is in any other multi-player deathmatch game on a console. A timer is required to decide the end of the match. Whichever team has the most points at the end gets a reward, be it Xp, points you accumulate to use in a shop for new items, etc. Like castle wars, but more of a kill concept rather than capture.
[/quote]
Wow. That acctually sounds really good. I’d love to see something like that![/quote]I was going to do it for reapagescape v3, but I’ve lost the time to work on anything honestly.

Read full topic

item.title: New ideas for private servers
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

The Reaper X:

Make a multi-player deathmatch mini game. Points go in increments relative to the amount of kills you obtain. You respawn as it is in any other multi-player deathmatch game on a console. A timer is required to decide the end of the match. Whichever team has the most points at the end gets a reward, be it Xp, points you accumulate to use in a shop for new items, etc. Like castle wars, but more of a kill concept rather than capture.

Wow. That acctually sounds really good. I’d love to see something like that!

Read full topic

A timer is required to decide the end of the match. Whichever team has the most points at the end gets a reward, be it Xp, points you accumulate to use in a shop for new items, etc. Like castle wars, but more of a kill concept rather than capture.
